alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 7:40AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 940 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. Including the cities of Temecula, Hemet, Lake Elsinore, Idyllwild-Pine Cove, and the Apple El Dorado Burn Scar. * WHEN...Until 940 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roads during the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally rain. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.15 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moreno Valley, Temecula, Redlands, Lake Elsinore, Yucaipa, Hemet, Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, Idyllwild-Pine Cove, Forest Falls and Mt San Jacinto State Park. This advisory includes the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
